skill.name: developer-growth-analysis
skill.description: Analyzes your recent Claude Code chat history to identify coding patterns, development gaps, and areas for improvement, curates relevant learning resources from HackerNews, and automatically sends a personalized growth report to your Slack DMs.
skill.summary: Analyzes your recent Claude Code chat history to identify coding patterns, development gaps, and are...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Filesystem access is limited to reading the user's local Claude Code chat history file. Network access occurs through documented MCP tool usage for HackerNews searches and Slack integration - standard patterns requiring explicit user authorization.

low_findings.title: Local chat history file access
low_findings.description: The skill accesses ~/.claude/history.jsonl to read chat history from the past 24-48 hours. This is necessary for the skill to analyze development patterns but involves reading local user data.

low_findings.title: MCP tool network access via Rube
low_findings.description: The skill uses Rube MCP tools to search HackerNews and send reports to Slack. This involves network communication through external integrations that users must authorize.

content.value_statement: You want to improve as a developer but struggle to identify specific gaps. This skill analyzes your recent Claude Code chats to reveal patterns, pinpoint improvement areas, and deliver curated learning resources directly to your Slack.
actual_capabilities: Reads and analyzes your recent Claude Code chat history
Identifies development patterns, technologies used, and problem types
Detects skill gaps and improvement areas from your actual work
Generates a comprehensive growth report with evidence-based recommendations
Searches HackerNews for curated learning resources
Sends personalized reports directly to your Slack DMs
limitations: Only analyzes Claude Code chat history, not other IDEs or tools
Cannot access projects or code files directly
Requires Rube MCP connection for HackerNews and Slack features
Analysis is limited to the past 24-48 hours of chat history

use_cases.title: Weekly Growth Review
use_cases.description: Get a structured analysis of your recent coding work every week. Identify patterns, track improvement, and receive targeted learning recommendations.

use_cases.title: Focused Skill Development
use_cases.description: Identify specific technical gaps in your work. Receive curated HackerNews articles and actionable recommendations for growth.

use_cases.title: Personal Development Tracking
use_cases.description: Use on an individual basis to support team member growth. Reports are private and delivered to personal Slack DMs.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Get a quick overview of recent work
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my developer growth from my recent chats

prompt_templates.title: Today Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my work from today and suggest areas for improvement

prompt_templates.title: Weekly Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a complete developer growth report for the past week with learning resources

prompt_templates.title: Specific Period
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my developer growth from last Tuesday through Friday

output_examples.input: Analyze my developer growth from my recent chats
output: Your Developer Growth Report - Report Period: Yesterday to Today
Work Summary: You focused on backend API development with TypeScript and Node.js. Primary work involved feature implementation and bug fixes.
Improvement Area 1: Advanced TypeScript Generics - You struggled with typing connection data structures. Recommendation: Study utility types and discriminated unions.
Improvement Area 2: Async Error Handling - Several race conditions observed. Recommendation: Implement proper error boundaries and Promise patterns.
Strengths: Strong debugging instincts, methodical problem breakdown.
Action Items: 1) Practice TypeScript utility types, 2) Review async patterns.
Learning Resources: 2 curated articles from HackerNews attached.

best_practices: Run the analysis once per week to track your improvement trajectory over time
Focus on one improvement area at a time before moving to the next
Use the curated HackerNews resources as a study guide and apply patterns to your actual projects
anti_patterns: Running analysis too frequently may not show meaningful patterns
Trying to address all improvement areas simultaneously
Skipping the curated resources without reviewing them

faq.question: What chat history does this skill access?
faq.answer: It reads from ~/.claude/history.jsonl containing your recent Claude Code interactions from the past 24-48 hours.

faq.question: What are the limits on the analysis period?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes chat history from the past 24-48 hours by default. You can specify custom date ranges in your request.

faq.question: Do I need to set up any integrations?
faq.answer: Yes. Rube MCP connection is required for HackerNews searches and Slack message delivery features.

faq.question: Is my chat data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Chat data is analyzed locally. Network calls to HackerNews and Slack occur through authorized MCP tools only.

faq.question: Why am I not getting a report?
faq.answer: Ensure you have recent chat history, Rube MCP is connected, and you have Slack authorized for DM delivery.

faq.question: How is this different from code review tools?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes your development patterns and workflow, not your code. It identifies skill gaps and recommends learning resources based on how you work.
